children.subject:
Would you recommend dropping 170 then and enrolling 61c? I have thought about this but i have questions about that, if I were to swap and take 16b, 61c, 188 next sem. 

1) is the lab scheduling with 61c and 16b too hectic? i know 16b labs are pretty crazy but not sure about 61c or their projects.

2) is it okay delaying 170 until the first sem of junior year? I originally thought this was late, but again I have no experience.

In general, if you have any schedule suggestions for this I would be more than happy to see them :) Thanks for the response!
Also, I am not sure if 61c is going to expand, which is another concern about whether or not i'd want to give up the spot i have in 170

hmm I'm actually not sure which one I would swap (maybe consider pushing 188 to a future semester since it isn't a prereq for anything, but i presume that would increase the net workload by a good bit. probably don’t push 16b because of enrollment concerns.). but to answer your questions:
1) 16b relaxed the labs a bit this semester (b/c remote) and it comes out to about 3h a week for lab. if they hadn't relaxed it, it probably would've taken much longer for me but 3h is the scheduled lab time. 61c lab is usually a few hours but can be longer for a couple notorious labs. projects take decently long (like 61B).

2) the beginning part of 170 is what some people find useful for interviews, and the timing of that seemed to overlap pretty well with recruiting in the fall.

Thanks for the information and the help! It's good to know they relaxed the labs quite a bit. So from my understanding it seems like pushing back 170 until junior year fall (1st semester of it) doesn't delay anything too much? Because of the overlap with recruiting (since it doesn't happen too much in spring)?
some classes on my list that don't need 61c are 126, 127, 189, 168 though I'd recommend taking 61c next sem because then you have more flexibility to take 161/162/164/186 whenever
186 TA here. Although 61C is recommended, plenty of students (me included) have done fine without it.
As a heads up: 186 doesn't enforce the 61c pre-req. I won't comment on the class itself, but it can be taken without 61c and doesn't involve low-levelprogramming in assembly or C
161 does not enforce the pre-req either. The class will be more challenging for the first 4 weeks or so without 61C, but after that there's no 61C content at all.

history.content: You may want to ask the CS Advisors this question. In the meantime, I can share that usually pre-reqs are more like guidelines. If pre-reqs will be enforced, I call it out on the CLASS NOTES for the class at classes.berkeley.edu so be sure to read those.

Hi, so next semester would be my first declared sem and I’m currently enrolled in 16b, 170 and 188 as of now. Assume I take these three pnp or not just for assumptions, I would have to take 61c next fall but what other upper divs can I take alongside it? It seems like almost all upper divs like 186,161 and everything require it for prereq. Is it enforced? Thanks for any advice! Also, next fall would be the start of junior semester with 61c if that makes a difference.
history.subject: Upper divs without 61c enforced prereq
